title: New surge of migrants strains U.S. capacity ahead of May 11 deadline
description: Border Patrol facilities are stretched to capacity along the U.S.-Mexico border as the Biden administration plans to lift pandemic-era restrictions May 11

title: Chile, Peru discuss safe passage for stranded migrants
description: Stranded for five days under the scorching desert sun alongside a highway, Venezuelan Rosmary Morales looks on helplessly at a wall of police officers blocking her passage into Peru

title: Mexico leader beats COVID, vows to end transparency agency
description: Mexico’s president has returned to his morning press briefings after recovering from COVID-19, and he came out swinging

title: US principal forced out in 'porn' flap views David statue
description: A former Florida school principal who was forced to resign after students were shown an image of Michelangelo’s iconic statue of a nude David has viewed the masterpiece in person

title: Mexico's economy grew 1.1% in 1st quarter, 3.8% year on year
description: Mexico’s economy grew by 1.1% in the first quarter of 2023, bringing growth to an annualized rate of 3.8% compared to the same period of 2022

title: They fled fighting in Sudan, only to find a crisis at the Egyptian border
description: At least 14,000 Sudanese have escaped to Egypt in the past week, braving dangerous roads and checkpoints, only to find themselves in another humanitarian crisis.

title: In Lebanon, Iran FM visits Israel border, extolls Hezbollah
description: Iran’s top diplomat has visited Lebanon’s border with Israel, expressing support for the Lebanese militant Hezbollah group in its struggle against their common enemy: Israel

title: Palestinians: Israeli forces shoot, kill teen in West Bank
description: The Palestinian Health Ministry says Israeli forces shot and killed a teenager in the occupied West Bank

title: Brazil's Lula resumes recognition of Indigenous land areas
description: Brazil President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva has approved the creation of six Indigenous territories, the first such move after a five-year hiatus in Indigenous demarcation

title: King Charles III: A visual biography ahead of his coronation
description: Prince Charles is now King Charles III. A look at his life in photos and videos offers hints about what sort of monarch he may be beyond his coronation.

title: Pakistan: 3 troops, 7 militants killed in overnight attacks
description: Pakistan’s military says three soldiers and seven militants were killed in three separate overnight attacks in the country’s volatile northwest

title: 2 journalists killed in Haiti as gang violence spikes
description: Two local journalists have been killed in Haiti over the past couple of weeks as rampant gang violence has gripped the capital of Port-au-Prince and surrounding areas

title: Japan to lift COVID-19 border controls before holiday week
description: Japan will lift most of its coronavirus border controls, including a requirement that entrants show proof of three vaccinations or a pre-departure negative test, beginning Saturday as the country’s Golden Week holiday season begins and a large influx of foreign tourists is expected

title: How rich is King Charles? Coronation prompts scrutiny of royal wealth.
description: People may find it amusing to know the king technically owns all the swans, but a growing number in the U.K. view the royal family as an expensive relic.

title: In Photos: Russian attacks hit cities around Ukraine, killing over a dozen people
description: Russian attacks hit cities around Ukraine, killing at least 19 people, officials said early Friday. In Kyiv, authorities said the capital came under the first missile attack since early March.

title: BBC chairman to resign over million dollar Boris Johnson loan deal
description: Sharp was appointed chairman of the BBC by Boris Johnson after he introduced the then prime minister to a businessman who guaranteed a 800,000 pound loan for him.

title: Turkish evacuation plane shot at as latest cease-fire struggles in Sudan
description: Echoes of ethnic clashes and genocide of 20 years ago have also erupted in the western Darfur region in battles between ethnic Arab and African armed groups.

title: The scariest advancements in North Korea missile tech so far
description: The flurry of North Korea missile tests show these claims are not just empty words and reflect actual progress, as Kim is making his arsenal easier to launch and harder to track.

title: Dutch court bans sperm donor who fathered at least 550
description: A Dutch court has banned a man from donating any more of his sperm after he fathered at least 550 children in the Netherlands and other countries and misled prospective parents about the number of offspring he helped to conceive

title: French actor Eva Green wins $1M in spat over 'B movie'
description: French actor Eva Green has been awarded $1 million by a British court in her dispute over the collapse of a project she feared was destined to become a “B movie” that could ruin her career

title: German capital sees 10th day of provocative climate protests
description: Climate activists are staging a 10th straight day of protests in Berlin

title: Hong Kong's economy is recovering, but its freedoms are not
description: It’s a city of two tales: After years of protest, crackdown and pandemic restrictions, Hong Kong is returning to normal — or is it

title: Heavy clashes rock Sudan’s capital despite truce extension
description: Sudanese residents say heavy explosions and gunfire rocked parts of Sudan’s capital, Khartoum and its twin city of Omdurman, despite the extension of a fragile truce between the county’s rival top generals

title: Queen's coronation recalled as UK prepares to crown her son
description: In 1953, London was still recovering from World War II

title: Pakistan releases Chinese national charged with blasphemy
description: A defense lawyer says a Chinese national who was arrested in Pakistan on charges of blasphemy has been released after a court granted him bail

title: Ukraine live briefing: At least 5 killed as Russia stages attacks in Dnipro and Uman
description: A 3-year old and a young woman were killed in Dnipro. Three other people were killed in Uman. Air alarms blared early Friday from Kyiv to near the front line.

title: Why the fighting in Sudan spells trouble for its neighbors
description: Fighting in Sudan may inflame conflicts within its seven neighbors’ borders: Egypt, South Sudan, Chad, Central African Republic, Libya, Ethiopia and Eritrea.

title: Death sentence upheld for Thai gold robber who killed 3
description: Thailand’s Supreme Court has upheld a death sentence for an ex-elementary school principal convicted of killing three people, including a toddler, during a gold shop robbery in 2020

title: Donated MiG jets will not give Ukraine air superiority against Russia
description: Ukrainian pilots call the MiG 29 an "old friend," but as Kyiv receives up to 30 of them from Poland and Slovakia, military officials and other experts say the planes aren't a game changer.

title: Gunmen kill 15 people, abduct 5 aid workers in north Nigeria
description: Authorities in Nigeria say at least 15 people were killed and five aid workers were abducted by gunmen in separate attacks in the West African nation’s troubled northern region

title: On world tour, DeSantis walks in Trump’s illiberal shadow
description: The trip’s highlight may be Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis’s loss of composure when asked by reporters about his poll numbers. But we also got a glimpse of his foreign policy thinking.
